title: Sri Lanka expects 65000MT of urea given by India after a month: Minister
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT  – Sri Lanka is expecting a 65,000 Metric tonnes of urea provided by India to be shipped in about a month, Agriculture Minister Mahinda Amaraweera said.
India has diverted a part of a large order made from Oman to Sri Lanka following appeals by Sri Lanka’s leaders to Prime Minister Naredra Modi.
“We expect it to be shipped from Oman to Sri Lanka in about a month,” Minister Amaraweera told Sri Lanka’s Derana television.
“It will come in bulk and we will have to bag it and distribute which will also take a few days.”
The cabinet of ministers on June 06 has approved the proposal to pay for the consignment from an Indian credit line, he said.
Amaraweera said the government hoped to give a pack at 10,000 rupees, compared to a market price of around 40,000 rupees now.
